storyTitle: As Manager, I want to view real-time attendance status to achieve timely workforce oversight

testCases.title: Validate dashboard real-time data updates
preconditions: Manager account exists with valid credentials and role-based access
Manager has authorization to view attendance data for at least one team
Attendance database contains current day attendance records
Dashboard service is running and accessible
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the dashboard login page and enter valid manager credentials (username and password), then click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Manager is successfully authenticated and redirected to the attendance dashboard. Dashboard loads within 3 seconds displaying current attendance data with employee names, status indicators, and timestamps

steps.action: Locate the filter panel on the dashboard. Select a specific team from the team dropdown and select today's date from the date picker. Click Apply Filters button
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard immediately updates to display only attendance records matching the selected team and date. Filter criteria is visible in the active filters section. Data loads within 2 seconds

steps.action: Note the current timestamp displayed on the dashboard. Wait for 30 seconds without interacting with the page. Observe the dashboard for automatic refresh indicator
steps.expectedResult: After 30 seconds, dashboard automatically refreshes. A refresh indicator briefly appears. Attendance data updates with the latest information including any new check-ins, status changes, or late arrivals. Updated timestamp reflects the current time

postconditions: Manager remains logged into the dashboard
Applied filters remain active after auto-refresh
Dashboard continues auto-refresh cycle every 30 seconds
All attendance data displayed is current and accurate

testCases.title: Verify export functionality for attendance reports
preconditions: Manager is logged into the attendance dashboard
Dashboard displays attendance data for at least one employee
Browser allows file downloads
Manager has export permissions enabled
Sufficient storage space available on local device

steps.action: Locate and click the Export button or icon on the dashboard toolbar
steps.expectedResult: Export options modal or dropdown menu appears displaying two format options: 'Export as CSV' and 'Export as PDF'. Both options are clearly labeled and clickable

steps.action: Click on 'Export as CSV' option from the export menu
steps.expectedResult: CSV file begins downloading immediately. File is named with format 'Attendance_Report_YYYY-MM-DD.csv'. Download completes successfully. Opening the CSV file shows all visible attendance data in tabular format with columns for Employee Name, Department, Team, Date, Check-in Time, Check-out Time, Status, and any relevant notes

steps.action: Return to the dashboard and click Export button again. Select 'Export as PDF' option from the export menu
steps.expectedResult: PDF file begins downloading immediately. File is named with format 'Attendance_Report_YYYY-MM-DD.pdf'. Download completes successfully. Opening the PDF file shows a professionally formatted attendance report with company header, report title, date range, filtered criteria (if any), and attendance data in a well-structured table format with proper pagination

postconditions: Two files are downloaded: one CSV and one PDF
Both files contain identical attendance data matching dashboard display
Files are accessible and readable in their respective applications
Dashboard remains in the same state with filters intact
Manager remains logged in

testCases.title: Test dashboard accessibility on mobile devices
preconditions: Mobile device (smartphone or tablet) is available with iOS or Android OS
Mobile browser (Chrome, Safari, or Firefox) is installed and updated
Mobile device has active internet connection (WiFi or cellular data)
Manager has valid login credentials
Dashboard URL is accessible from mobile network

steps.action: Open mobile browser on the device. Enter the dashboard URL in the address bar and navigate to the page. Enter manager credentials and login
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully on mobile browser within 5 seconds. Layout automatically adjusts to mobile screen size with responsive design. Navigation menu collapses into hamburger menu. Attendance data is displayed in mobile-optimized card or list view. All text is readable without horizontal scrolling. Touch targets are appropriately sized for mobile interaction

steps.action: Tap the hamburger menu or filter icon to open filter panel. Select a department from dropdown, select a team, and choose a date using the mobile date picker. Tap Apply button. Scroll through the attendance data vertically. Tap on individual attendance records to view details
steps.expectedResult: Filter panel opens smoothly as a slide-out menu or modal. All filter controls are easily accessible and functional with touch input. Date picker displays mobile-native calendar interface. Dashboard updates immediately after applying filters showing filtered results. Vertical scrolling is smooth without lag. Individual records expand or navigate to detail view when tapped. All interactive elements respond correctly to touch gestures

steps.action: Locate and tap the Export button on mobile dashboard. Select CSV format from export options. Wait for download to complete. Then repeat export process selecting PDF format
steps.expectedResult: Export button is easily accessible on mobile interface. Export options menu displays clearly with touch-friendly buttons. CSV export initiates and file downloads to mobile device's download folder or prompts save location. Download notification appears in device notification bar. PDF export completes successfully with file accessible through device's file manager or downloads app. Both files can be opened using appropriate mobile applications

postconditions: Dashboard remains functional on mobile device
Both CSV and PDF files are saved on mobile device
Manager remains logged in on mobile session
Mobile browser session is active
Exported files are accessible through mobile file system

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to filter attendance data by department and date to achieve focused analysis

testCases.title: Validate filtering by department and team
preconditions: Manager is logged into the attendance dashboard
Manager has access to multiple departments and teams
Attendance database contains records for multiple departments and teams
Dashboard is fully loaded with unfiltered attendance data
Filter panel is visible and accessible

steps.action: Open the filter panel on the dashboard. From the Department dropdown, select one department (e.g., 'Engineering'). From the Team dropdown, select one team (e.g., 'Backend Team'). Click Apply Filters button
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard updates within 2 seconds to display only attendance records for employees belonging to the selected Engineering department and Backend Team. Record count updates to reflect filtered results. Active filter tags appear showing 'Department: Engineering' and 'Team: Backend Team'. All displayed records match the filter criteria

steps.action: Locate and click the Clear Filters button or remove all active filter tags
steps.expectedResult: All applied filters are removed immediately. Dashboard refreshes within 2 seconds to display complete unfiltered attendance data for all departments and teams the manager has access to. Filter dropdowns reset to default 'All' or empty state. Record count returns to total number of attendance records. Active filter tags disappear

steps.action: Open filter panel again. Select multiple departments by checking checkboxes for 'Engineering' and 'Sales'. Select multiple teams by checking 'Backend Team', 'Frontend Team', and 'Sales Team A'. Click Apply Filters button
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard updates within 2 seconds showing attendance data for all employees belonging to either Engineering or Sales departments AND belonging to Backend Team, Frontend Team, or Sales Team A. Multiple active filter tags are displayed. Record count reflects the combined filtered results. All displayed records satisfy all selected filter criteria (logical AND operation between filter types, OR within same filter type)

postconditions: Dashboard displays filtered attendance data matching last applied criteria
Filter selections remain active in filter panel
Manager can continue to modify or clear filters
Dashboard performance remains responsive
Session and login state are maintained

testCases.title: Verify date range filtering functionality
preconditions: Manager is logged into the attendance dashboard
Dashboard displays attendance data
Date range filter controls are visible in filter panel
Attendance database contains historical records spanning multiple dates
System date and time are correctly configured

steps.action: Open the filter panel. Click on the Start Date field and select a date from 7 days ago using the date picker. Click on the End Date field and select today's date. Click Apply Filters button
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard updates within 2 seconds to display attendance records only within the selected 7-day date range. Date range is displayed in active filters section showing 'Date Range: [Start Date] to [End Date]'. All displayed attendance records have dates falling within the specified range. Records outside this range are not visible

steps.action: Modify the date range by selecting an End Date that is earlier than the Start Date (e.g., Start Date: today, End Date: 3 days ago). Attempt to click Apply Filters button
steps.expectedResult: System immediately displays a validation error message: 'End date cannot be before start date' or similar. Error message appears near the date fields or as an alert banner. Apply Filters button is either disabled or clicking it does not apply the invalid filter. Dashboard data remains unchanged showing previous valid filter results. Date fields may be highlighted in red indicating validation error

steps.action: Correct the date range by changing the End Date to a date after the Start Date (e.g., Start Date: 5 days ago, End Date: today). Click Apply Filters button
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message disappears. Dashboard successfully updates within 2 seconds displaying attendance data for the corrected valid date range. Active filter shows updated date range. All displayed records fall within the new date range. Record count updates to reflect the filtered results

postconditions: Dashboard displays attendance data for valid date range
Date range filters are active and visible
No validation errors are present
System maintains data integrity
Manager can continue filtering or clear filters

testCases.title: Test filter preset save and load
preconditions: Manager is logged into the attendance dashboard
Filter panel is accessible
Manager has permission to save filter presets
At least one department and team are available for filtering
Preset management functionality is enabled

steps.action: Open filter panel. Select specific filters: Department = 'Engineering', Team = 'Backend Team', Date Range = 'Last 7 days'. Click Apply Filters to confirm filters work. Then click 'Save Preset' or 'Save Filter' button. Enter preset name 'Engineering Backend Weekly' in the dialog box. Click Save or Confirm button
steps.expectedResult: Preset save confirmation message appears: 'Filter preset saved successfully' or similar. The preset name 'Engineering Backend Weekly' appears in the saved presets list or dropdown. Preset is associated with the manager's account. Current filters remain active on the dashboard. Save dialog closes automatically

steps.action: Clear all current filters to reset the dashboard. Open the saved presets dropdown or list. Select the preset named 'Engineering Backend Weekly' by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard immediately applies all saved filter criteria within 2 seconds. Filters are populated in filter panel showing Department = 'Engineering', Team = 'Backend Team', Date Range = 'Last 7 days'. Dashboard displays attendance data matching the preset filters. Active filter tags appear showing all applied criteria. Record count updates to reflect filtered results

steps.action: Open the saved presets list. Locate the preset 'Engineering Backend Weekly'. Click the Delete or Remove icon/button next to the preset name. Confirm deletion if prompted
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog appears asking 'Are you sure you want to delete this preset?'. After confirming, preset is immediately removed from the saved presets list. Deletion confirmation message appears: 'Preset deleted successfully'. The preset 'Engineering Backend Weekly' no longer appears in the presets dropdown or list. Current dashboard filters remain active but are no longer associated with a saved preset

postconditions: Preset has been created, loaded, and deleted successfully
No saved preset named 'Engineering Backend Weekly' exists
Dashboard may have active filters but no preset is selected
Manager's account and session remain active
Filter panel is ready for new filter operations

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to export attendance reports to achieve offline analysis and record keeping

testCases.title: Validate CSV export of filtered attendance data
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized manager
Attendance dashboard is accessible and loaded
Attendance data exists in the system (at least 100 records)
Browser allows file downloads
User has export permissions enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully displaying attendance data with filter options visible

steps.action: Apply filters on dashboard (e.g., select date range: last 7 days, department: Engineering, status: Present)
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard refreshes and displays filtered attendance data matching the selected criteria. Record count updates to reflect filtered results

steps.action: Note the number of records displayed and key data points (employee names, dates, status) from the filtered view
steps.expectedResult: Filtered data is clearly visible with accurate record count displayed on dashboard

steps.action: Click on the Export button and select CSV format from the dropdown menu
steps.expectedResult: Export options menu appears with CSV option highlighted. Export progress indicator is displayed

steps.action: Wait for CSV file generation to complete
steps.expectedResult: CSV file is generated within 10 seconds. Download prompt appears or file automatically downloads to default download location. Success notification is displayed

steps.action: Locate the downloaded CSV file and open it using spreadsheet application (Excel, Google Sheets, etc.)
steps.expectedResult: CSV file opens successfully without errors. File contains proper column headers and data rows

steps.action: Verify CSV file contains the same number of records as displayed on the filtered dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Record count in CSV matches the dashboard filtered record count exactly

steps.action: Compare sample data points from CSV (employee names, dates, attendance status) with the dashboard display
steps.expectedResult: All data points in CSV accurately match the corresponding data shown on the filtered dashboard. No data discrepancies found

steps.action: Verify CSV includes only the filtered data and not unfiltered records
steps.expectedResult: CSV contains only records matching the applied filters. No records outside the filter criteria are present

steps.action: Check CSV formatting including column headers, data alignment, and special characters
steps.expectedResult: CSV is properly formatted with clear column headers, data is correctly aligned, special characters are properly escaped, and no formatting issues exist

postconditions: CSV file is successfully downloaded and saved
Dashboard remains in filtered state
Export activity is logged in the system
User session remains active

testCases.title: Validate PDF export of filtered attendance data
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized manager
Attendance dashboard is accessible and loaded
Attendance data exists in the system (at least 100 records)
Browser allows file downloads and can display PDF files
User has export permissions enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully displaying attendance data with filter options visible

steps.action: Apply filters on dashboard (e.g., select date range: current month, department: Sales, status: All)
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard refreshes and displays filtered attendance data matching the selected criteria. Record count updates to reflect filtered results

steps.action: Note the number of records displayed and key data points (employee names, dates, status, hours worked) from the filtered view
steps.expectedResult: Filtered data is clearly visible with accurate record count and details displayed on dashboard

steps.action: Click on the Export button and select PDF format from the dropdown menu
steps.expectedResult: Export options menu appears with PDF option highlighted. Export progress indicator is displayed

steps.action: Wait for PDF file generation to complete
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is generated within 10 seconds. Download prompt appears or file automatically downloads to default download location. Success notification is displayed

steps.action: Locate the downloaded PDF file and open it using PDF reader application
steps.expectedResult: PDF file opens successfully without errors or corruption. Document displays properly formatted attendance report

steps.action: Verify PDF report header includes report title, generation date, applied filters, and company/department information
steps.expectedResult: PDF header contains all required information: report title 'Attendance Report', current date/time, list of applied filters, and relevant organizational details

steps.action: Check PDF formatting including table structure, column headers, font readability, and page layout
steps.expectedResult: PDF is professionally formatted with clear table structure, readable fonts, proper column alignment, appropriate spacing, and correct page breaks. Headers repeat on each page if multi-page

steps.action: Verify PDF contains the same number of records as displayed on the filtered dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Record count in PDF matches the dashboard filtered record count exactly. Total count is displayed in PDF footer or summary section

steps.action: Compare sample data points from PDF (employee names, dates, attendance status, hours) with the dashboard display
steps.expectedResult: All data points in PDF accurately match the corresponding data shown on the filtered dashboard. Data integrity is maintained

steps.action: Verify PDF includes only the filtered data and not unfiltered records
steps.expectedResult: PDF contains only records matching the applied filters. No records outside the filter criteria are present

steps.action: Check PDF for proper page numbering and footer information
steps.expectedResult: PDF includes page numbers (e.g., Page 1 of 3), footer with generation timestamp, and user who generated the report

postconditions: PDF file is successfully downloaded and saved
Dashboard remains in filtered state
Export activity is logged in the system
User session remains active
PDF is print-ready and shareable

testCases.title: Test export authorization and logging
preconditions: Test environment has multiple user roles configured (Manager with export permission, Employee without export permission)
Attendance dashboard is accessible
Attendance data exists in the system
Export logging functionality is enabled in the system
Access to system logs or audit trail interface

steps.action: Log in to the system using an employee account without export permissions
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in and is redirected to their appropriate dashboard view

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads but export functionality is either hidden or disabled based on user permissions

steps.action: Attempt to access the export functionality (if visible, click Export button; if hidden, attempt direct API call or URL manipulation)
steps.expectedResult: System denies the export request. Error message is displayed: 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to export attendance data' or similar. HTTP 403 Forbidden status is returned for API calls

steps.action: Verify that no export file is generated or downloaded
steps.expectedResult: No file download occurs. User remains on the dashboard with error notification visible

steps.action: Log out from the employee account
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged out and redirected to login page

steps.action: Log in to the system using an authorized manager account with export permissions
steps.expectedResult: Manager successfully logs in and is redirected to manager dashboard with full permissions

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully with export functionality visible and enabled

steps.action: Apply specific filters on dashboard (e.g., date range: last 30 days, department: Marketing)
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays filtered attendance data matching the selected criteria

steps.action: Click on the Export button and select CSV format
steps.expectedResult: Export process initiates. Progress indicator is displayed

steps.action: Wait for export to complete and verify file download
steps.expectedResult: CSV file is generated and downloaded successfully within 10 seconds. Success notification appears: 'Export completed successfully'

steps.action: Navigate to the system audit logs or export activity log section
steps.expectedResult: Audit log interface loads successfully displaying recent system activities

steps.action: Search or filter logs for the most recent export activity
steps.expectedResult: Export log entry is found in the system logs

steps.action: Verify export log entry contains: username/user ID of the manager who performed export, timestamp of export action, export format (CSV), applied filters details, and export status (success)
steps.expectedResult: Log entry contains all required information: Manager username/ID is correct, Timestamp matches the export time (within seconds), Export format is listed as CSV, Applied filters are documented (date range: last 30 days, department: Marketing), Status shows 'Success' or 'Completed'

steps.action: Verify the unauthorized export attempt from step 3 is also logged with denial status
steps.expectedResult: Log entry exists for the failed export attempt showing: Employee username/ID, Timestamp of attempt, Action: Export Attempt, Status: Denied/Failed, Reason: Insufficient permissions

postconditions: Unauthorized user remains unable to export data
Authorized manager successfully exported data
All export attempts (successful and failed) are logged in the system
System security and authorization controls are validated
Audit trail is complete and accurate
